comments.text: Where was Dazai when i was growing up
I'm just going to add that those small details have been my favorite thing all season from the show :)
He was most likely dead.
With the port mafia
In Japan?
Nah he ded for a very long time.

Born too late to know Dazai

Born too early to explore the Galaxy

Born just right to watch Tsuki ga Kirei
I'll fucking take it!

I think this shows I was born in the right era... Tsuki ga Kirei makes me happy I was born when I was...

Born just right to watch OreImo... Eromanga... A show literally called NTR... On second thought I may be in the wrong era...
Born just right to watch the great romance anime, we are really lucky aren't we?
We are blessed

I was curious who exactly Dazai was and if he even was a real person/author. [He's real and very famous within the Japanese Literature world](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osamu_Dazai), and I was surprised he died so young at the age of 38. He had a rough life and committed several suicide attempts and finally doing it with a woman who he moved in with after abandoning his wife and children.
He got several women to commit suicide with him. Misery sure love company...or life just suck that hard back then.
How do you get people to commit sucide with you? People sure are fucking dumb to get so involved in another person's ideals.
Watch the show [Aoi Bungaku](https://myanimelist.net/anime/7193/Aoi_Bungaku_Series), its adaptations of various literature including what is something like Dazai's autobiography.
Love how premise! Thank you.
Some stories are definitely better than others but overall very good show.
How did he get *several* women to commit suicide with him? Any sources on that?
read the wiki linked above.

When you say several you mean 2 LOL

And a failed third, of course.
Trying to commit double Suicide
Dazai..Dazai...I remember he & his works were theme of one of the arcs in *Bungaku Shoujo* (the theme being *suicide*)
Trying?
Well, he tried a few times before he finally succeeded, so depending on when one was growing up it's the right word or not.
Reference to Bungou Stray Dogs.
Well, the actual writer by the same name did commit double suicide.
yes but he failed a double suicide before he succeeded (which probably didn't help cuz his lover/wife died while he survived)
I thought Dazai was a "comical" representation of the actual Dazai taking in consideration his dialogue and personality.

The characters in BSD are either based on the author, on characters the author wrote, or a mix, or completely new personas. Like for example, Dazai trying to commit suicide all the time is a reference to the actual author, while Fitzgerald is kinda like Gatsby with the whole money is power thing, but also still references the real author's wife. I think maybe Atsushi doesn't have much in common with his real author, I don't know a lot about the real author.
The entire series has some truth to it.
Floating down a river with a random woman

It says a lot about this show that I was *relieved* the episode was focused on Kotarou's familial strife because it means for once I don't have to worry about him and Akane...

[](#elsiesigh)

The stress is real. On the other hand these two are just too fucking cute. I'm pretty sure I contracted diabetes when they kissed at the end of their date. Such whiplash. One more episode until we can all relax and smile though!

^^Or ^^put ^^these ^^pitchforks ^^to ^^good ^^use...

I'm also going to keep linking the [ED Line translations](https://brownricecookies.wordpress.com/2017/06/22/tsuki-ga-kirei-ed-line-chats-episode-11-benippo/) to help ensure everyone sees them as this lovely show comes to a close!
I just caught up with the show and now have to check out those translations! Thanks for those!
This is awesome, I always wondered about those chats and my Japanese is still not good enough to read it all! Thanks for these!
Just so you know, the screenshot for your ep 12 post will spoil everyone who goes back to this thread and clicks on that link.
This episodes one was awesome lol. With people speculating that the conversations is in fact them this one gives me hope for the future.
Those line texts are as adorable as ever. Thanks for linking the translations friend.

Ahaha. Fuck High School tbh.

I'm glad i was able to choose my Uni with no oversight or intervention.
Man, the conversations each week are so realistic I wonder if they just copied it from someone's chat log ;-)
Most brutal cliffhanger. I need to know if he fucking passes. This ship cannot fucking sink.
I can't do another 5cm Per Second ending.

> This ship cannot fucking sink.

I'll pump out the water with a bucket myself if I'll have to  but sail on, goddamn it, sail on!
[Tsuki ga Kirei](/s "The ship won't sink. If you read the ED chats translations, you can see some of them happen in the future when they are married to each other")
[Spoiler](/s "It's only speculation that the messages are of them. There are no explicit names or anything, just nicknames so it could be anyone.")
The one on this episode is named after the toy Akane carries around.
I definitely don't want to be Makoto Shinkai'd all over again....
He's almost certainly failing.
Have some faith for the guy
Show is too realistic for him to pass. You can't just randomly change your grades all of a sudden unless you were just completely not trying before.
based on his grades yeah. He had what, 4 subjects of the 5 that were below standard.... it's not looking good.
He had 3 out of 5 subjects that were below 60... Did you misread the year average as his personal score?
I think I was just remembering wrong

I can kinda see that happening with all these little signs in the episode. Him getting distracted from Akane's text and losing his concentration during the late night study scene. As well as his mock exam scores not being great.
But in the end, I really just hope I'm wrong and he passes even if it was just barely. Would hate to imagine how much time they would lose, not being being able too see each other as much.
If you actually counted his scores, he was only 12 points below the standard of getting average 60 per subject.
The show has been surprisingly realistic about almost everything so far.  Middle schoolers' relationships not working out in the long run is just another bit of realism.
What if it's all been a setup so that Chinatsu and Hira end up with the one they've been pining for just by proximity and availability...
You may see on the news that feel. studios' office has burned down... nothing to do with me I swear.
I'm still optimistic that he'll pass and we'll have a happy ending. This anime it's so sweet it can't be otherwise
My money is on him failing, and they have to do the long distance thing. Which, I hope, works out at least for awhile.

There are many hints that point towards a brake-up. Akane's sister mentions that the first love doesn't last forever. His friends make jokes and his parents know it too, etc. We all want it to last but life is not that easy.

I know u.u what her sister said is the bigger break up flag, but i don't want to believe it u-u

You might want to check out the spelling

Is it really a happy ending if he spends 4 hours on a train everyday? If he does pass hopefully they do a time-skip and we can be sure that they don't break-up shortly after and maybe he starts living by himself in the area or something.
He'd have time to write his novel.

That's how he makes his living. He just writes random novels while on the train. He becomes known as the Travelling Mastermind and is limited to only writing his novels on a form of transport. He then joins the UA as his novels have began to become real. He defeats Deku and Uraraka in the festival and is greater than All Might...

Got a bit carried away there... not gonna lie.

Yeah you really went far there.  
  
He's quirkless, he can't join...
No his quirk is his novels, because they came to life fam... it turns from a romance to a supernatural really quick.
More likely he joins the Armed Detective Agency and swoons every time Dazai as much as glances in his direction.

Never even thought of that... 

He'd swoon whenever anyone looks his way, as I believe all the characters are based off famous authors. Soseki's 'Tsuki ga Kirei desu ne' is used in his damn confession, so he'd drop dead if Natsume looked his way too!

Yeah the Armed Detective Agency would fit much better.
Ya but it is also so much more realistic in how it handle things what makes it a bigger risk.

My cute little romance anime can't be this realistic! 

;_;
But that realism is part of what makes it so cute. They have small sweet moments between them that are real and not  stuff played up for dramatic effect.

Yeah that's what I really love about Tsuki too!

 Was just making a meme haha
NOOOOOOO! This show rises above any meme status..
I know, and this show it's been pretty realistic so far. Well, i have a whole week to prepare myself
Which is why I'm bracing myself for complete and utter heartbreak next episode

Him failing doesnt mean them over. We dont really see them interact all that much at school, or we could ahve Akanes dads job fall through. Im thinking it goes one of two ways. He fails, but her dads job ends up not moving them and they stay together. He fails but something to do with his writing happens (like a job offer/scholarship to some literature based school/something else) and they end up together and happy.

I dont think we'll get a 5cm ending here.
I don't think it's either "he passes" or "heartbreak ending". They could always do LDR.
Haha. Yeah, right.

Toradora springs to mind...

Or a more closely related one is Koukou Debut (A manga series) Although Idk if that's spoilers...

> Or a more closely related one is Koukou Debut (A manga series) Although Idk if that's spoilers...

That series will always have my respect for never once having a break up. Break ups are the cancer of the romance genre.
I know... except for that horrible arc around the 30s-40s... you know... the cram school arc? That arc is so annoying and bad... I honestly nearly dropped it (glad I didn't tho).
To decide that it's hopeless before the episode even airs is nothing but cowardice.
Is next week's episode the last one?

I wonder if they're gonna pull out a timeskip 4 years into the future, where they're dating other people out of nowhere, next episode. Middle school relationships aren't as concrete once you get older, but we can always hope that they can make their relationship last.
Yes
[Stop...](#emptyinside)

Fuck, that made me cry. 

Appreciate your parents, everyone. Especially your mom's, they might be naggy, but they care for your well-being. Ah fuck, that hit so close to home. 

I might give this show a 10/10 if the ending also hits.
I'll be the downer here and say unfortunately that isn't always the case.
Yeah, some parents can suck

> some parents can suck

welp, they had raging hormones too once upon a time

*Sigh*...  
Endeavor...

I'm hoping the final episode will be a bit of a time-skip into the future, given that they've been foreshadowing a lot of stuff with the ED text messages as well as the overall hope of keeping the relationship together.
Are those translated anywhere?
https://brownricecookies.wordpress.com/tsuki-ga-kirei/

Those are really cute. Matches the shows theme of realistic enough but still hopeful relationships so I expect we'll get the same in the finale. Fails exam, gets scholarship to relatively local school for literature due to writing somehow, go long distance for a few years then he becomes writer and she goes to college and they stay together.
I want a time skip where they have finished school are living together married and have kids...
Basically [](/s "Itazura na Kiss") .
Is it you, Mr. director?
nope
i'd be fine with this too.

I want a timeskip where it shows him struggling to make a 2 hour commute daily to a school he's almost flunking out of, forced to be in a class with his middle-school ex-girlfriend for hours upon end, and then amidst this living hell he finally realizes that this was the worst fucking idea ever. Roll credits.

Or could have one where he fails, but they go LDR for a couple of years and end up with him getting a writing job and her at college living together a few years later.  I think there are lots of ways they could make a happy ending. Doesnt have to be a 'and then the ywere perfect together forever' since thats not the feel of the show, but I think just a 5cm style ending him failing them breaking up the end isn't going to happen.
I feel like this would be a pretty good SoL in and of itself.
Don't forget a return to the more nihilistic Dazai quotes
Maybe Kotarou will take direct inspiration from Dazai and drown himself.
[](#whatamireading)
that triggered me so much, i almost downvoted you
Hahahahaha it would be the most bullshit rug pull ending of all time and yet I can't stop laughing at the thought of that happening

To be honest though....

How fuckin realistic is that?! I mean, hell you know the shit I used to do for my ex's back in the day only to realize that it did not pay off what so ever! Hell, I moved across the country to be with this chick I thought was "the one" only to have it blow up in my face hahaha.

I would be so damn furious if this happened but at the same time insanely impressed. It would deserve a top 10 Most Shoking Moments in Anime for SURE! ^^Brought ^^to ^^you ^^by ^^WatchMojo

I think that would erode a lot of what the characters have been built up to be. However, I do think it's a genuine possibility that he'll just fail, and they'll be forced apart. 

I still don't have a solid grasp on whether this show is idealistic or realistic, and that scares me, but it also makes it *so* much more interesting compared to the standard romance.
Ah that takes me back. Fucking bitch. At least I didn't try to immigrate to be with her, dodged a bullet and only wasted a couple grand on travel.

Meh, it's pretty common for someone to move across the country to be with their boyfriend/girlfriend, fiance, or spouse. Maybe not realistic for middle schoolers, but undergrads, grad students, and graduates do it all the time.

> and graduates do it all the time.

and here I am thinking about moving to my girl's place and start doing business. 2real4me

> but undergrads, grad students, and graduates do it all the time.

Yeah, but there's a slight difference between them and middle schoolers, that slight difference being *raging hormones*.

Next week is really going to be hard. 

Tsuki ga Kirei and Suka Suka ending.

I'm going to bet that since this is an original series and it's only 12 episodes long, it could get a second season pending the financial reception (per the usual). From the way the story is going, that seems to be the team's hopes as well. I'm hoping for another season, anywho.
Damn why did you remind me
GOD I DIDNT THINK ABOUT IT UNTIL YOU SAID SO. Both of em could end up super happy or super soul shattering. God I hope it's the first.

FUCK.

I don't think my heart could take this. Hopefully at least one of 'em ends happily, just to pick me back up after the other one (or I guess if I watch in the other order, break my heart after it's been pumped full of sugar)
Lets face it, we know how SukaSuka is gonna end.
It ended just as I imagined. I don't know if I can make it through Thursday lol
Well since SukaSuka is an adaptation the jury is already out, but this one nobody knows about!

Do not fret. If we don't get what we want we just need to bury the sadness with RAGE. PURE, BLINDING RAGE.

[TRYING NOT TO CRY](#wallpunch)
At least we have New Game next season to pick us back up.
They really missed the opportunity of calling it New Game+...
ikr? I was hoping for a Dark Souls nod of sorts, but they missed it hard
"New Game+" is waaaay older than Dark Souls.
Oh of course it is, but nowadays when you say NG+, most people I can think of think about DkS
I'm calling it New Game+ with zero fucks given about what it's supposed to be.
Easily best episode of the season. Loved the family theme.
Definitely one of the most realistic families I have ever seen in anime.
Gotta love how you can empathize with both sides to a degree and despite enjoying Akane x Kotarou moments, I think most of us would favor the parents over Kotarou.
Last weeks episode was the best imo

> Easily best episode of the season

_Pffft_, didn't even have any shorts

[](#rinkek)
Inb4 more than half of the finale next week are shorts.
Haha, yeah I was slightly disappoint at lack of shorts but the rest of the episode more than made up for it. If next episode is finale then I don't expect shorts in that one either :(
I bet they're over – time to put away childish things.
Maybe we'll get an OVA with only a bunch of shorts <3
Well, if they wanted to do more of them and the recent lack is because of production issues they will probably have them as some kind of special on the blu-ray.

I wouldn't say it's to do with any production issues, since the length of the episode is still the same. Episodes with shorts tend to be about 15 minutes of content, 3 minutes of OP/ED and 3 minutes of shorts at the end.

agree, this episode really did it for me, with his parents and his mom's interactions with the teacher, her seeing his desk, etc... seeing curly and akane together on their christmas date, too. hnnggghh ;_;

And we rarely see this kind of thing since MCs parents in most shows are usually offscreen due to being in overseas/far away job/on vacation, both dead, big shots of the society. Or we have a single parent or a loli mom. Not the usual family set-up of a father, mother and their children.

It's really a good thing that this series is an anime original and not an LN adaptation.

I think I need to call my mom now.

[](#makicry)
Really puts into perspective how even with a father like mine who was always a hard ass and strict...He just wanted what was best for me. I wish I knew this earlier when I was at middle/high school.

As a parent, one of the hardest things in the world to do is watch your kids learn from mistake after mistake. 

But with that said, watching them figure it out after all that is incredibly gratifying.

When they were exchanging gifts, I was somewhat hoping Azumi would readjust the scarf to also wrap Akane's neck. Now that would have melted my heart.

 [](#comfy)

I was screaming at my screen.

Man he sure doesn't know how to be smooth as fuck does he christ.
glad I wasn't the only one haha
Me too. Really hoped he was going to do that.

Very rare for an anime to have a perfectly functioning parents for the main characters and that are both PRESENT. Not in overseas, not dead, but are functioning adults that simply wishes what is the best for their kid.

This series keeps breaking conventions. I love it.

We need more of this stuff in anime.
And apparently it's doing well in Japan too (#3) from a previous thread, I hope this has some effect on newer shows!

good episode. that scene where curly finds out akane passed the exam with chinatsu is fucking great. 

there's no way he won't pass, they wouldn't do that to us. right? ;_;
I predict that he doesn't pass, but they do LDR and stay together.
This is the same guy who made Angel Beats

No way Jun Maeda wrote this. 

Just checked. Different writers but directed by the same guy.
Sadly  with the style of the show there is a bigger chance of him not passing.. Not to mention those text conversations in the credits.
But, at least, these conversations seem to hint that they do manage to keep their long distance relationship going.
Next episode will lead into 5cm/s.
I can't do this again. I just can. I don't want a Shinkai ending. I want it less than I want certain infectious diseases.
Don't even mention that name. Not around this pure and cute romance. Do not corrupt Akane and Azumi with your Shinkai depression machine.
Stahp!

He fails, stays in the small town and Chinatsu messes with him for three years before he graduates and moves to Tokyo in pursuit of Akane, but by then she's married someone else and they meet in passing at a rail crossing.... oh god no.
This is a space dandy reference right?
[basically a plot for a Makoto Shinkai movie](/s  "5 Centimeters Per Second")
Hi Makoto Shinkai
Pls no

[THESE](http://i.imgur.com/xA5ogp8.png) [TWO](http://i.imgur.com/omu8sAP.png)

Seriously they are too adorable. The scarf, the texts, the date to the kiss. They just warm my heart.

The mom stole the episode though. Anime moms always pull at my heartstrings but [this line](http://i.imgur.com/qctD4Eo.png) just got me. The end with him supporting him like that it's actually okay if he fails. ^^^But ^^^pls ^^^don't
Looks like the preview is setting up something bitter sweet.

My favorite bit was when he tried to sneak a peek at her fortune, and they just ended up leaning against each other back to back. Because I dunno, it just seemed like such a *real* thing for a couple to do. Which is so damn rare in anime.

Reminded me of my best friends wedding. They played a game with their backs to one another while they each hold one of each persons shoe, while the host makes them vote for themself or their spouse by holding one in the air, to questions like 'is always punctual' 'is more adventurous' 'cooks better food' etc. The whole game was adorable as fuck because they kept turning to sneak peaks at the others answer and just giggling away the whole time.

Also yeah this is a late response im just now getting around to this awesome show.
They just looked so happy too :)
I loved how she  stood there puckering up waiting for her kiss. It is like she is saying ok now this is the part you kiss me. She seems to be really liking them.
Yeah seen that in a few in anime and always love it <3

> I loved how she stood there puckering up waiting for her kiss.

The best part was her face while waiting for him, all giddy and wanting to give him the present.

They also slowly changed while having these intimate moments together. In the beginning of the series, moments of awkwardness or silence led to more awkwardness while they tried to intuit what to do next and now they just end up giggling about it. There's so much growth of comfort and trust between them.
Truly beautiful episode. His mother is actually a very good mother.
shes a good mom and is learning from her mistakes so thats awesome
Can't blame her for taking so long to figure out she's actually getting what she wanted all along for her kid. Moms normally don't expect a girlfriend to make their kid get serious about life.
Thing is he hasn't actually told his parents she is his gf I don't think. All they know is there is a girl he likes.
I'd sure like to know what got discussed at that private mom/teacher conference.

This was [my face](http://i.imgur.com/Jugh6J5.jpg.jpg) when Akane gave Koutaro the scarf and at the same time he gave her the handkerchief.

I'm loving Akane even more in these past two episodes, she has grown up so much and she's not the shy awkward girl afraid of getting close to Koutaro. She's more straightforward now and she's the one asking for the kisses.

Kou's mom being a real trooper, changing her stance and supporting her own son despite the odds and profesional advice from his teacher. Another shoutout for pinkhead Roman for being the best bro anyone could ever have.

There's only one episode left and so much to cover, like the test results, wheter Chinatsu will jump in, and there's even what will happen to most of the kids from the extras including sensei and Roman. I just hope they only focus on Akane & Kou-chan and give us a proper ending.

The ost in this show is just amazing, the insert songs are so heartwarming and melancholic. I'm looking forward when the ost is released
My opinion of the mom has shot way up this episode.
What was your opinion of her before? She pretty much always looked out for her son.

As someone who didn't really care for mom before this episode let me tell you.

Before this episode (and even at the beginning of it) I pretty much hated the mom. She didn't support her son at all it seemed. Then this episode she got mad at the beginning because of his choice for school. 

But the Dad talking about how she was showing her support and fought the teacher for his chance to apply turned her around. Hell, she even stayed up late to make a snack for him! Then made his a lunch to have at his exam. She became such a great mom in a matter of one episode. 

I think the problem was that as a viewer, I didn't think about how she was always trying to look out for his future.

She got mad at his choice in school because his choice of school is pretty naive imo. 

Akane's sister is right, what if they break up? Now he's stuck 4 hour commute everyday plus they never really talk at school anyway and they can still meet up one weekends.

I think his mother has always been realistic, yeah, it's cools to want to be a writer but how many are making a living do it? And such a long commute might make it difficult to keep up with school work.

I never didnt agree with Akane's sister. She had a really good point. Also, maybe in middle school they will talk at school?

And yeah, the mom has always had good intentions but just the way she came off was what made her not likable for a while...

It bothered me before but I've always seen her in a positive manner, she genuinely wants her son to be successful/happy and always has, perhaps it has been in a little harsh and overbearing way. I've had the impression from other commenters sometimes that she's a unsympathertic/uncaring mother but she's just the typical bad cop mum, good cop dad.

It's really interesting to see this kind of family dynamic in a show. I was in the exact same position as Kotarou: Asian parents, only child, mother who was vocal about her definition of success and a father who encouraged me to do what I want. I had flashbacks of exact conversations with both of my parents during the scene when Kotarou's dad tells him he should write and in this episode when his mom was concerned about his future.

Seeing the acceptance of his mom at the end and her concern about leaving on time and making sure he had everything felt so similar when I finally left my parents' house to leave for college. This show hit home for me in ways I never expected it to and is by far the show I look forward to most every week.
Kinda reminds me of the snippets we've seen from Shikidai's family in Boruto. Temari is very strict and Shikamaru laid back as usual.
If this anime doesn't end in a positive note, **I AM GONNA RIOT**

Well this will be the last time, but here's a translation of the [TV guide preview of next week's episode](http://s.mxtv.jp/anime/tsukigakirei/episode.php?ep_id=7275_13):

[Tsuki ga Kirei EP12 PV](/s "Episode 12(FINAL) - And Then. Akane's move gets closer. The high school tests are over, and the two are weighed down by the anxiety that comes with long-distance relationships. Tears fall as Akane packs her things, meanwhile Kotarou pens down his feelings. The day after the graduation ceremony they have their final date before Akane moves. Somehow their feelings which are supposed to be mutual pass each other by...")

I'm going to miss this show no matter what happens next episode :(

I'm calling this [Tsuki ga Kirei hypothesis](/s "Kotarou is not going to give up. Imo that would be out of character. This guy has already shown us a lot of times he has a strong will, he is willing to put everything on the line for what he wants. Maybe a distant relationship won't work, but I don't think he will give up without trying. He's not the type. The last sentence probably refers to Akane thinking they would break up in the last date. Well, maybe I just don't want to be Shinkai'd ")
I hoped so much it was not going to end like that, and I still do.
I'm not ready for this :(
I mean this could just be clever wording to make us more anxious and worried. They wouldn't spoil what happens in the preview description, would they?
Yeah it's always like this and the last sentence ends with what implies that they omitted something. But from the sound of the rest [](/s "Koutarou probably fails the entrance exam").
Well fuck. I guess the best I can hope for is a bittersweet ending in which they agree on a long distance relationship. The last sentence worries me though.

My guess? [](/s "He wants to keep the relationship going, she wants to end it, because she thinks it'll be too hard on him. Somehow, he convinces her either through his writing or by showing up to see her. Turns out the LINE messages in the ED are of them.")
I'd be okay with that. I'll be honest, I just want some kind of happy ending with the two staying together.

So we go full circle up to the tragedies of first loves?

I can't...

Fuck... I just remembered my tragic first romance now...

Preview  hits so close to home.

Ah hell. Ah no. Good thing I didn't put the pitchfork away, Shinkai ending rearing it's ugly head again. I don't want to go to Anime Expo having to cry every time I see anything from this anime. PLEASE.
hmmm this reply is kind of spoilerish lol, by reading this I basically have a good gyst of what the PV is about lol... damn it i wish I didn't read this thread T__T
Sharpening my pitchfork as we speak. I've got a week to get it as sharp as possible.

Really nice episode. For a reference does anyone know how long of a commute he's looking at here? I had to do about 45-60 minuets each way for college in the uk (bike->train->bike both ways) which was a little painful but totally managable.

Not sure if i want him to pass or fail tbh. I'd possibly rather he failed, they went to different schools but met up and were impossibly cute together more often. Its not like they really interact at school much  (well, that we see). Oh also that he wins some manuscript award thing 'cause his dad snuck one into a competition.

So for next week (final?) we have the light novel/writing to tie up, does he get into school or doesnt he to tie up and what do they do going forwards.  Happy ending pls. Doesnt have to be "and then they were together forever and had 3 kids and a unicorn" just 'and for now theyre together and happy and noone needs to know what happens in the future' sort of thing.
dude, if there's a unicorn involved, it's a must to show it, imo.

That's a good point, they really don't spend all that much time together during school so it's not like they're missing much. Even at separate schools they could still check off all the anime couple events:

School Festival

Summer Festival

Cherry Blossoms

Christmas

She's really not going that far relatively speaking. It would hardly be unreasonable for them to hang out on the weekends.
If I recall correctly, last episode they said 2 hour commute each way every day.

She said it was 'over 2 hours one way'. So he's looking at upto 5 hours of commute daily!! It's the biggest reason I hope he fails (sry). But if the story is to be in-line with its realism, I don't think someone should sacrifice so much for love during their early years.

Me and my brother have both friends who literally live a state apart from us and they come to school everyday, a friend makes 3 hours of commute every day and a friend of my brother makes something like 4 hours of commute and they never whine about the distances, they made a conscious choice and they deal with it with joy (and some pain), so I think azumi can do it, and even enjoy his commutes

Wow, that's admirable. Do they do this mainly for better education (for lack of good schools in that area) or to be with friends?

As for Kotarou, who is a budding novelist, I think 5 hours is a lot of lost productivity.

They do it in part because where they live is not generally a good area, and there's not a lot of good schools there, so they decided to come to a better school, I admire their determination to do so. 

Aside from that, I think having good friends (me humbly included haha) is in part a reason to do it too. 

We study architecture so I feel like they loss a lot of hours, but that's what makes them great students, because they have to take the hours they have left and do the projects with a lot more organization than me
Yea just googled it, they're literally the opposite side of tokyo apparently. Fuckus thatus. Time to fail and something else happen like Akanes dads job gets cancelled.

What a beautiful episode. Really goes to show just how much love and concern can go into that motherly "nagging". I loved seeing both sides of the dynamic and in typical diabetic Tsuki ga Kirei fashion, having it wrap up in such a sweet way for the two of them.

At this point I think I'm fine with any outcome with the exam. He really did try his best up until now, and he has the support of everyone around him.

He probably won't make it, fits with the overall realism of the show and would make for a very good bittersweet ending in which they just sort of accept it, and maybe realize it was just their first love

I think the conversation with her sister and the emphasis on the gift-giving foreshadows that too. But this episode may lighten that load. They've both really improved as people together and become a lot happier, which I'm going to chalk up as a successful relationship. And who knows, maybe a long distance thing will work?
Oh my God, this could even end with LINE being a long-distance relationship savior.

> And who knows, maybe a long distance thing will work?

I think that could actually be how it goes. Maybe the (off screen) talk with her sister convinces her that going to different schools doesn't have to be the end of their relationship and so, even if he fails the exams, there no big catastrophe for them and the next episode (and season?) ends like all the others, without some dramatic cliffhanger.

I want to think they can pull it off, they are survived the winter break pretty well, and their love to LINE is a plus for it, also the ED conversations seem to be about a long distance relationship, and in this one they mention going to visit the other, so they could be them.

It would hardly even be long distance really. If it's 2 hour commute one-way, then the two could just meet in the middle every so often and it's much more manageable. Fortunately she's not moving all that far, relatively speaking.
Yeah, I have the hope that if we get Shinkai-ded, it won't be that bad due to this
I'm not sure that our MC's breaking up would count as a "very good happy ending." I suppose they could make it bittersweet in a way, but happy? No way in hell, in my opinion.
Yeah, sorry. Meant bittersweet

> just their first love

The problem with this take is that they're both such sensitive, introverted types that it's hard to imagine them simply walking away from the huge emotional investment they've each made in getting to know each other. And I think they both know it.
I have such a huge weakness for "Mom" episodes. Loved this one so much.

Dazai once said "Tsuki ga Kirei is one of the best shows you're gonna watch"

Last week I said that you could not improve much more from what was presented in episode 10. God, I was so wrong.

This is cute, is heartwarming, is beautiful. The family theme is the  cherry on the cake. Absolutely gorgeous.

My boy Kotorou is shaping up~ I'm getting very excited for what's going to happen next.

At the same time, I am upset because we didn't get any shorts. PLEASE, I NEED TO KNOW WHAT HAPPENS TO THESE SIDE CHARACTER RELATIONSHIPS.

I'm gonna be a little specific with my ending prediction. I hope Kotarou passes but Akane convinces him to go to a closer school anyway. I think it tells a good story for Kotarou, for Akane, and for their relationship that way.

It shows how Kotarou and his commitment to his relationship with Akane has actually improved his life outside of those aspects. Akane's encouragement is part of what helped him stay motivated to write when his novel got shot down and now he's showing much more dedication to his school work. It shows that childhood relationships aren't always a distraction that take away from other important aspects of life. 

Akane showed a lot of growth during the show and I think her convincing Kotarou to go somewhere closer to home would be a great way to show the culmination of that. She was very passive early on and it felt like Kotarou was the only one trying to push their relationship forward. Recently she's been playing a much more active role. I think convincing Kotarou to go to a closer school shows she's comfortable enough with Kotarou to speak against what he wants and that she cares about him enough to worry about his well being.

For the relationship, it feels like a long distance relationship is the best option for them. The entrance exams alone have been taking their toll on Kotarou and he hadn't even had to deal with the 2 hour each way commute yet. It feels like something is going to give between the commute, new classmates, his grades in a tough school, and his personal work writing. Trying to balance all that will likely end with him so exhausted he can't give any of those aspects the attention they need to be successful. However, it's obvious from the way Akane and Kotarou have acted these last couple episodes that they really don't want things to end just because of the distance. The show has also been going out of their way to show how much they communicate though line and the EDs are filled with line chats of long distance relationships.

If we are to take into account what appears to be foreshadowing in episode 11 alone (Kotarou's talk with his dad and Chinatsu's passing comment), it would seem that Kotarou is going to fail the entrance exam to Koumei Private High School and end up going to the same local university that Chinatsu is going to go to. This will make no difference to Kotarou and Akane's relationship, because...

If the ED line chats are, as I very much do hope so, foreshadowing the future for Kotarou and Akane, they will survive their long-distance relationship into adulthood and marriage.
you sir have summized my thoughts on this show prepping for the last episode.  Thank you.

Azumi parents MVP.


It's nice to see how their relationship developed and they aren't shy of each other anymore. Well done romance. 


I hope it all ends well and we'll have one of the best romance shows in the last few years!

Great parents indeed! Kotarou's mom really wanted to give full support to him as she realised Kotarou is seriously studying for his selected school and not just playing around as she initially thought. (Kotarou never really told them he had a girlfriend nor discuss much else as seen from previous episodes of their family dinner) Once Kotarou told them to 'shut up' it made his parents rethink the way they were treating him. Seeing his mom actually staying up late to make him food made me cry like a bitch.
Also wanted point out the parallel between Kotarou eating after the fight he had between the parents and after seeing his mom. He was first reluctant to eat his moms food, but after seeing her cook late at night for him, he didnt give it a second thought. Its the little things that make it a great episode in my heart.

And there is his dad too. He noticed the relationship between Kotarou and his mom were shaky and wanted to patch things up between them by letting him know that they arent against his choice, and he can freely do what he wants so long as he has a backup plan (public school if he failed) and that he would takes responsibility. [long sentence but wanted to put it out there] The dad was a great middle man of the two and a real understanding father!!!

And the morning of the exam. It was only for a minute but the last few scenes reminded me so much of how my parents were like when I had exams. They would already be up before I was,  preparing my lunch and making sure I didn't forget anything. There was so much I could relate to my experiences. And the scene when the parents were outside sending Kotarou off. Baring with the cold of early morning to watch him leave safely. Made me appreciate how great it is to have your parents full support into your life decisions.

This episode was really great and moved me so much. Even though it doesn't focus much on the romantic aspect (maybe it did but I was too moved by the parents), I want to say this was the best episode in anime that showed parental love being portrayed realistically (and I never would expected it from reading its synopsis!). Really sad that there is only one more episode to wrap this series up when theres so much to see from the main couple and the people around them.

When his dad told him about how his mom fought for him, I choked up a bit.  
And I remained that way till the end of the episode.

This show does really well with the romance bits.  
Like how she wanted to knit for him.  
How they wanted to spend some time together.  
And the kiss that they now do, and likely look forward to.

All of that is great.  
But other bits, like how his mom acknowledges his hard work, how she only nags because she cares and is concerned, and how she understands why he might be frustrated with her, but she continues to support him in whatever way she can, never expecting an apology or a thanks.  
And how when he finds out, he finds more strength to push forward.

This episode shows how parents can be; naggy, but caring.  
They are usually the silent heroes, supporting their kid from the background.  
And how that that support means the world to their kid.

It was a great episode.  
This show is really really good.
All the parent scenes were so relatable, fuck why is this show so good

Dazai once said, "If this were a novel, I would not have gotten into Koumei. It is to be expected. But this is not a novel. This is reality, and reality can be much better than we expect. Remember that."

One Piece author Eiichiro Oda once said in a interview he considers mothers in his manga are against their children going on adventures. That's how I felt Azumi's mom was at first, but I think when she found out how hard he was studying she decided to level the playing field for him. His dad's alternative was good to hear as well. Akane's older sister is such a delight when she's on screen and she has a point; couples like these are such a one in a million rarity, so she's looking out for her which is sweet as always :) Does it really end next week? I feel like it can continue; while I am a bit sad this series has to end it has been so amazing to watch week by week. My small regret though is that we may never see either family ever getting to know the couple which I would have loved to see that all laid out with their interactions. Such a strong episode start to finish :)
Yeah, I'd like to see the parents meeting the couple; would make for a very interesting scene :)
I have been waiting for that all series long since they first met at the restaurant lol.

They also seem to at times come with simplified entrance exams or even by pass it  only needing do something simple to get in.

Just 7 episodes ago these two same kids are having a difficult time looking at each other and holding each other's hand but just look at them now! I love how close these two have gotten!

The focus on family this episode is pretty nice. That first 3 minutes with Kotarou's mom was the most realest interaction with a parent I've seen for a while. While the last few minutes of this episode is probably the most I've related with this episode, I've gotten fights with my parents before but just like most Asian parents there's usually no dramatic apologies or anything to make up. There's just this silent agreement that they're cool now and I really liked how they did that.

Also props to Akane's sister for being realistic. Of course the ideal thing is for Kotarou and Akane to be together forever, but that won't always be the case and you need to think ahead just in case they do break up, which I really hope doesn't happen.

I applied to a different school and now, 5 years after I'd graduated, I don't see her around anymore. I believe it was a good decision for me at the time.

This show... Flood gates opened when Azumi went to the kitchen and saw her mother. Not much was said but you can read everything going through his head at that moment.

Ah, fuck. I need to keep my promise too. Finish this damn college education and get a job.

I expected Dad-bro to be the one backing up Azumi but no one can beat a mother's love.

That Christmas day kiss. Ahhhh! Stop it you two! Making me smile like an idiot.

This is why we need more families in SoL romances, they add so much to the story. As much as want Kotarou and Akane to live happily ever after, both his mom and her sister have a point. Middle school romances don't last and staking that much of future on it is a big risk, people change a lot at high school, so they may just simply grow apart.

I'm glad his mom was being supportive though once she saw how seriously he's taking it, whether it's enough though we'll have to see. I hope we get another meeting of families scene before this ends, should be hilarious.

I just noticed that I have almost the exact same pen as Kotarou does, the colour palette is just a bit different.

[His pen](http://imgur.com/a/TgXmA) and [Mine](http://imgur.com/a/rO4qf).

And when taking the pics I noticed [why they look similar](http://imgur.com/kGJMN8k). 

That's a really nice detail in the show, they didn't just draw some pencil, they actually used a real life model. Maybe one of the artists has it, or maybe its just a really common pen in Japan, because this is the best pen I've ever had.

Anyways, I really love when they use existing things as a basis in anime instead of just drawing a generic pencil or [headphones](http://imgur.com/o3szQXB)

Realistically, Kotarou going to the same high school that takes two hours to get to (and two hours to return home) every day just to be with his girlfriend would probably end up very disappointing on the being together end.

To begin with, they probably wouldn't have much, if any, time to meet in the morning after Kotaru's long commute. They will more than likely not be in the same homeroom. They probably won't have any of the same classes. They might not even have lunch at the same time so they might not even be able to share lunch together. So how much time would they get to spend together during the schoolday? Probably none.

And after school, well, Akane will have club so they won't be able to spend any leisurely time after school, either. If Kotarou hangs around for her, he could spend a few minutes with her before they each head home for the night. 

Travel time every day: four hours. Time spent with girlfriend every day: a few minutes, or more likely, none.
Quadratic equations.... really? o_o

I don't ask for much.

I just want Kotaro to pass his exam, and for us to get a happy ending.

I feel like so many stories these days try to go for some heart tugging bittersweet ending. If I could just get one bonafide happy ending, it'd make my day. 

Please don't let Shinkai anywhere near this ending. In fact, if he's even heard of this show, someone go wipe his memory.
There was something really poignant about him leaving in the cold dead of night to go to the school. Such a long commute, daily. What a commitment.

I think... at this point, i'm going to hope that Koutarou fails the exam. I love the couple to bits, but this show really pulled in the gravity and reality of the situation. Teenage naivety, parents who act like actual parents of a middle schooler, and the grades not magically soaring to the roof because he decided to start mugging.

With how realistic the show is, i'd rather they end it just as realistically, with Azumi missing his target, leading up to a teary ending than him managing to mug into the school and a happily ever after. The disconnect would be... disappointing.
Noticed some magic milk.

After all this, I'm actually okay with them drifting apart... such is time and it's many arrangements. Knowing the school system in east Asia, post graduation breakup isn't uncommon... still, I hope for a sweet ending and there will always be a corner in my heart where I cheer Akane and Kotarou on!

Another amazing episode for this show!

I love how the show not only gives us adorable sequences with the couple but also keeps things interesting with natural conflict. I feel like some shows like this fall into the trap of forcing conflict, but this show has avoided that so far

does anyone know that paper angel/doll thing that akane and kotaro does? Lol i wanna read more about its meaning and stuff

It is probably related to the Japanese custom of floating dolls down river to dispel bad luck. From [MIT Japan](http://www.mit.edu/afs.new/athena/course/other/jpnet/holidays/Mar/hinamaturi.shtml): "Originally, the paper dolls were made to represent each person and all the ill-fortunes that might visit that person in the coming year were wished onto the doll. Then the doll was sent away on the river, taking the bad luck with it."
Next week, we will see if this anime can win the "Could have fallen and shattered into a million pieces but didn't" award.
